DOC.brief_summary: This study test effectiveness mobile application use Application Program Interface ( API ) distribute evidence-based weight loss intervention . Half participant receive API-based application , half participant use non API-based application .
DOC.brief_title: Using API Commercialize Evidence-Based Weight Loss Intervention
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study test weight loss app use API disseminate evidence-based weight loss intervention . The investigator hypothesize , course 12 month , participant use Leaner app lose weight attention control group . Participants ( n=206 ) randomly assign use either intervention app ( intervention arm ; n=103 ) weight loss app choosing ( attention control arm ; n=103 ) 12 month . Assessments take place baseline , 3 , 6 , 12 month . Statistical analysis : A linear mixed model approach use test hypothesis . Observed weight vs. time plot analyze participant discern general trend weight change . The model include intervention effect , time effect , intervention time interaction , random intercept . In exploratory analysis , investigator examine weight change across subgroups interest ; investigator add subgroup variable interaction intervention indicator primary model . All analysis evaluate 0.05 significance level .
DOC.criteria: inform consent 2165 year old BMI 2540 kg/m2 ownership use Android smartphone past 6 month plan change phone/service study consent research team monitor app utilization use weight loss medication prior plan bariatric surgery psychiatric hospitalization past 12 month pregnancy , nursing , plan pregnancy study history cardiovascular disease ( CVD ) event selfreported history eat disorder use medication diabetes mellitus mobility restriction exercise contraindicated history condition ( e.g. , lithium , steroid , antipsychotic ) would affect weight measurement , weight loss contraindicate current participation another weight treatment study and/or recent weight loss > 10 % investigator discretion safety reason
